name: Veilid
summary: Single glass of pain for veilid-server 0.3.0
description:
Processing pipeline and simple dashboard for monitoring Veilid debug logs. This is just a first attempt and is definitely not handling all possible debug logs, just the stuff that I saw over the course of a day.

If you want to drop the non-Veilid logs coming in, edit the "Drop Non-Veilid Messages" rule in stage 0 of the Veilid Processing pipeline and remove "&& false" from the when condition.

description.@value: Process data coming from Veilid via Syslog

source.@value:
pipeline "Veilid Processing"
stage 0 match either
rule "Select Veilid Messages"
rule "Drop Non-Veilid Messages"
stage 10 match either
rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 0"
rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 1"
rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 2"
rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 3"
rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 4"
rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 5"
rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 6"
rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 7"
rule "Drop Syslog Facility Fields"
stage 20 match either
rule "Veilid Parse Bucket Kick"
rule "Veilid Parse Connection Accepted"
rule "Veilid Parse Connection Closed"
rule "Veilid Parse Connection Protect"
rule "Veilid Parse Dead Route Failed"
rule "Veilid Parse Get or Create Connection Retry"
rule "Veilid Parse LRU Kill"
rule "Veilid Parse RPC Drop"
rule "Veilid Parse RPC Get Value"
rule "Veilid Parse RPC Inspect Value"
rule "Veilid Parse RPC Lost"
rule "Veilid Parse RPC Set Value"
rule "Veilid Parse RPC Watch Value"
rule "Veilid Parse Receipt"
rule "Veilid Parse Routing Table Update"
rule "Veilid Parse SingleShot Receipt"
rule "Veilid Parse Timestamp Ahead/Behind"
rule "Veilid Parse RPC Failure"
rule "Veilid Parse No Protocol Handler"
rule "Veilid Parse Get Peer Address Fail"
rule "Veilid Parse Dialinfo Failure"
rule "Veilid Parse Dialinfo Permit"
end

rule "Drop Non-Veilid Messages"
when
    has_field("application_name")
    && to_string($message.application_name) != "veilid-server"
    && false
then
    drop_message();
end

rule "Select Veilid Messages"
when
    has_field("application_name")
    && to_string($message.application_name) == "veilid-server"
then
    rename_field("application_name", "event_source_product");
end

title.@value: Veilid Parse Get or Create Connection Retry

source.@value:
rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 7"
when
    has_field("level") && to_string($message.level) == "7"
then
    set_field("vendor_event_severity", "debug");
    rename_field("level", "vendor_event_severity_level");
end

rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 4"
when
    has_field("level") && to_string($message.level) == "4"
then
    set_field("vendor_event_severity", "medium");
    rename_field("level", "vendor_event_severity_level");
end

rule "Drop Syslog Facility Fields"
when
    has_field("facility") && has_field("facility_num")
then
    remove_field("facility");
    remove_field("facility_num");
end

rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 3"
when
    has_field("level") && to_string($message.level) == "3"
then
    set_field("vendor_event_severity", "high");
    rename_field("level", "vendor_event_severity_level");
end

rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 5"
when
    has_field("level") && to_string($message.level) == "5"
then
    set_field("vendor_event_severity", "low");
    rename_field("level", "vendor_event_severity_level");
end

rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 0"
when
    has_field("level") && to_string($message.level) == "0"
then
    set_field("vendor_event_severity", "emergency");
    rename_field("level", "vendor_event_severity_level");
end

title.@value: Veilid Parse Get Peer Address Fail

source.@value:
rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 2"
when
    has_field("level") && to_string($message.level) == "2"
then
    set_field("vendor_event_severity", "critical");
    rename_field("level", "vendor_event_severity_level");
end

rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 6"
when
    has_field("level") && to_string($message.level) == "6"
then
    set_field("vendor_event_severity", "informational");
    rename_field("level", "vendor_event_severity_level");
end

rule "Parse Syslog Log Level 1"
when
    has_field("level") && to_string($message.level) == "1"
then
    set_field("vendor_event_severity", "alert");
    rename_field("level", "vendor_event_severity_level");
end
